Ext.container.Viewport Example

Tags: Ext JS Ext JS 4.1.0 Ext.container.Viewport
[example]
© 2012 Sencha Inc. 
/*global Ext:false */
Ext.onReady(function() {
    Ext.create('Ext.container.Viewport', {
        layout: 'border',
        items: [{
            region: 'north',
            html: '
Page Title
',
            border: false,
            margins: '0 0 5 0'
        }, {
            region: 'west',
            collapsible: true,
            title: 'Navigation',
            width: 150
            // could use a TreePanel or AccordionLayout for navigational items
        }, {
            region: 'south',
            title: 'South Panel',
            collapsible: true,
            html: 'Information goes here',
            split: true,
            height: 100,
            minHeight: 100
        }, {
            region: 'east',
            title: 'East Panel',
            collapsible: true,
            split: true,
            width: 150
        }, {
            region: 'center',
            xtype: 'tabpanel',
            // TabPanel itself has no title
            activeTab: 0,
            // First tab active by default
            items: {
                title: 'Default Tab',
                html: 'The first tab\'s content. Others may be added dynamically'
            }
        }]
    });
});
